abstract: The top United States banks could face up to $31 billion in losses from buying back bad mortgages, Standard & Poor’s said in a report on Thursday.
snippet: The top United States banks could face up to $31 billion in losses from buying back bad mortgages, Standard & Poor’s said in a report on Thursday.
lead_paragraph: The top United States banks could face up to $31 billion in losses from buying back bad mortgages, Standard & Poor’s said in a report on Thursday, Reuters reports.

headline.main: Banks Face $31 Billion Loss on Mortgage Buybacks
